intro: Cacalia subglabrata, commonly known as the smoothleaf thistle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and features a hairy stem with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators. Cacalia subglabrata is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
